Here's what a JavaScript equivalent for PHPâ€™s array_chunk might look like

{% highlight javascript %}
function log1p (x) {
  //  discuss at: http://phpjs.org/functions/log1p/
  // original by: Brett Zamir (http://brett-zamir.me)
  // improved by: Robert Eisele (http://www.xarg.org/)
  //        note: Precision 'n' can be adjusted as desired
  //   example 1: log1p(1e-15);
  //   returns 1: 9.999999999999995e-16

  var ret = 0,
    // degree of precision
    n = 50
  if (x <= -1) {
    // JavaScript style would be to return Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY
    return '-INF'
  }
  if (x < 0 || x > 1) {
    return Math.log(1 + x)
  }
  for (var i = 1; i < n; i++) {
    ret += Math.pow(-x, i) / i
  }
  return -ret
}

{% endhighlight %}

## Notes
- Precision 'n' can be adjusted as desired

## Example 1

{% highlight javascript %}
log1p(1e-15);
{% endhighlight %}

Should return

{% highlight javascript %}
log1p(1e-15);{% endhighlight %}
